introduction.title: Welcome to our robot factory!
content: As a supervisor, your task will be assemble and train robots to perform various tasks.
But before you can start, you need to go through mandatory training that will teach you how these robots work.

introduction.title: How do robots learn?
content: The robots in this facility learn using machine learning techniques, primarily neural networks and reinforcement learning.
To understand how they learn, let's first look at neural networks-one of the core systems powering their decision-making.

introduction.title: What is a neural network?
content: A neural network is made of layers of connected nodes that transform input data, adjust internal parameters, and improve with training.
This allows the robot to recognize patterns, make decisions, and enhance its performance over time.

introduction.title: Your first task
content: Before you start to create fully functional robots, you need to prove that you know how to create and use neural networks.
Your first task is to set up a basic neural network and explore its architecture to understand how it processes and learns from data.

introduction.title: Instructions
content: You can build your neural network in the workshop.
Start by adding nodes to the input and output layers, and include at least one hidden layer with a few nodes.
If you're unsure about any feature, click on the info icon to view an explanation of its purpose.

firstPuzzleNotSolved.title: Task incomplete
content: The basic neural network has not been set up yet. Return to the workshop and complete the network setup by adding input, hidden, and output layers.

firstPuzzleSolved.title: Task completed!
content: You set up your first network and learned about network architecture.
Now, you'll will build a network that will power our sorting robot, so that it can classify robot parts into different categories.

firstPuzzleSolved.title: Your second task
content: Each incoming part has three properties: weight, energy consumption, and material type.
Your neural network must analyze these properties and correctly determine whether a part belongs to a Worker, Cleaner or Explorer.
Adjust the network's hidden layers and neurons to achieve the highest classification accuracy.

secondPuzzleNotSolved.title: Task incomplete
content: The neural network is not yet set up to classify robot parts. Return to the workshop and complete the network setup by adding input, hidden, and output layers.

secondPuzzleSolved.title: Task completed!
content: You successfully set up a neural network that can classify robot parts.
Now, you'll need to train the network.

secondPuzzleSolved.title: How training works?
content: Training begins by pressing the "Train" button.
Before starting, you can set the number of training cycles and the learning rate using the input fields.
Once training starts, open the Evaluation panel to monitor progress and observe how the neural network improves over time.
